FuncDef: This command specifies the criterion to adjust the priority based on the test result. Multiple criteria can be specified with the condition that they are not conflicting or overlap. If the returned value is within the specified range, the priority can be disabled, lowered or raised.

ParaDef.Info: Specifies the SNMP value against which the test result is matched up to 256 characters in length.
Specifies the SNMP object type against which the test result is matched. Values-integer, unsigned, string, ip-address, counter, time-ticks, opaque.
Specifies that the destination may not be used for the amount of time specified in the hold-time command when the test result matches the criterion.
Specifies the amount to lower the priority of the destination. Values-1 to 255.
Specifies the amount to raise the priority of the destination. Values-1 to 255.
